item.title: How to Run Podman and Docker-Compose on Windows
item.description: As you know containers are a Linux thing. Microsoft introduced its solution but I’ve never seen them used. To use containers we have mainly two alternatives: docker and podman. I prefer the latter for two reasons. Because it has a daemonless architecture and because it doesn’t need root permission. But using it with docker-compose on Windows is tough. That’s why I decided to write and share this story. Motivation I think using Docker Desktop on Windows is the fastest way to use containers.
